person.persName: Manoah P. Clarkson (Grayson County, Kentucky, innkeeper and tavern keeper)

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, innkeeper and tavern keeper. Virginia native. Son of James F. Clarkson and Elizabeth Moreman Clarkson. Married to Zerilda Herndon Clarkson. Father of Fannie Z. Clarkson and Oscar Clarkson. Married to Sarah Fanny Vanmeter Clarkson. Father of James V. Clarkson and Clinton K. Clarkson. Moved to Kentucky with his family. Deputy clerk in Hardin County, Kentucky, under Samuel Haycraft. Clerk in Louisville, Kentucky. Moved to Grayson Springs, Kentucky. Postmaster of Grayson Springs from 1841 to 1844, 1848 to 1851, and 1852 to 1887. Innkeeper in Grayson County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Tavern keeper in Grayson County in 1860. Owned and operated the Grayson Springs Hotel resort.
